results.title: Lights, Camera, Los Angeles
results.creator_credit: Robert F. Gingg, Jim Settlemoir and Candlelight Associates
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Video visits”.
Discover L.A.’s earliest beginnings at Mission San Gabriel and the busy market place on Olvera Street. Experience the renaissance of downtown L.A. at the Music Centre and Museum of Contemporary Art. We see the Rose Bowl and Pasadena’s Huntington Gardens. Have fun at the famous amusement parks and Griffith Park, then hello to Hollywood and all that glitters!
results.creator_credit_for_label: Robert F. Gingg, Jim Settlemoir and Candlelight Associates

results.title: Japan: The Island Empire
results.creator_credit: Maureen Zrike, Christopher Zrike and International Video Network
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Video visits”.
Japan begins to unfold as you enter a Zen temple, then witness an ancient ritual in a Shinto shrine. In the resort of Ibusuki, you will marvel at guests buried to the neck in steaming volcanic sand. Admire the great Buddha of Kamakura and the splendid architecture of 400 year old Himeji Castle. Then plunge into the frantic pace of Tokyo during the Sanja Matsuri Festival.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Maureen Zrike, Christopher Zrike and International Video Network

results.title: Eternal France
results.creator_credit: August von Kageneck, James R. Conner and Kageneck Video
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Video visits”.
From the Roman ruins in Provence to Napoleon’s Arc de Triomphe in Paris, the rich history and culture of France awaits you. Wander inside the majestic Cathedrals of Reims and Chartres. Watch the artistry of glass-makers in Baccarat, the lacemakers in the Auvergne and silk painters in Lyon. Then, marvel at the beauty and mystery of Brittany’s stunning abbey of Mont-Saint-Michel.
results.creator_credit_for_label: August von Kageneck, James R. Conner and Kageneck Video

results.title: Athens and the Greek Spirit
results.creator_credit: Frank Gorin, Britta Halling and Calcon
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Video visits”.
Tour bustling Plaka, just below the Acropolis. Watch the changing of the guard outside the Parliament building, then tour the Academy. A view of the Greek Islands - tour the Acropolis and marvel at the Parthenon.

results.title: New Zealand: Islands of Adventure
results.creator_credit: Ceidrik Heward, Peter Newport and International Video Network
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Video visits”.
Discover why New Zealanders call it “God’s own country”. The awe-inspiring scenery of the North and South Islands with subtropical beaches, mountain glaciers, steaming geysers and rich farmlands, make this country a natural wonderland. Meet New Zealand’s original inhabitants, the Maoris, who arrived by canoe from Polynesia more than 1,000 years ago. Fly over the snow-capped peaks of Mount Cook and ferry across the beautiful and remote Mallborough Sounds. Enjoy the breathtaking scenery along Milford Track and visit Auckland, the largest city and a boat owner’s paradise.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ceidrik Heward, Peter Newport and International Video Network

Fly over the snow-capped peaks of Mount Cook and ferry across the beautiful and remote Mallborough Sounds. results.title: New York: City of Cities
results.creator_credit: Peter May, Jerilyn Goodman, Producers Group and International Video Network
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Video visits”.
There’s no city on earth like New York. Start with the Statue of Liberty, welcoming beacon to millions of immigrants; continue on to Wall Street, seat of the stock exchange and quiet Trinity Church. Jostle through the garment district, gawk at the world’s tallest skyscrapers, and have a guided tour of NBC. Go inside the Metropolitan Museum to see the works of Van Gogh, Gauguin and Warhol, then continue on to the Guggenheim, Lincoln Centre, and Radio City Music Hall. Proceed to Broadway and Sardi’s Restaurant, with its walls of celebrity caricatures. Ride through Central Park in a horse-drawn carriage, then visit the United Nations. Enjoy the atmosphere of Chinatown, Greenwich Village, Little Italy, and Soho.

results.title: Impressions of Hong Kong and Macau
results.creator_credit: James Omi, Patrick Sun and Video Postcard Souvenirs
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Video visits”.
Jetfoils and junks, sampans and ferries skim across the harbour as you begin your visit to Hong Kong. Push through the crowded streets of this bustling financial centre and enjoy the folk theatre performances going on all around. Shop in the street markets and elegant department stores. Enjoy a change of pace in the outer islands, dotted with quiet fishing villages, serene monasteries and isolated beaches. Visit Macau, the oldest European settlement in Asia.
results.creator_credit_for_label: James Omi, Patrick Sun and Video Postcard Souvenirs

results.title: Germany: A Tapestry of Tradition
results.creator_credit: James R. Conner and Heumann-Reiss Production Group
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Video visits”.
Visit West Germany, land of castles and kings, cathedrals and alpine peaks. Experience the quiet mystery of the Black Forest. Watch a craftsman carve a violin in the village of Mittenwald. Continue on to the awe-inspiring Gothic cathedrals of Wurzburg, Ettal and Nymphenburg. See the fairytale castle of Neuschwanstein, built by eccentric King Ludwig II, come alive. Then, join in the celebration of Munich’s Oktoberfest!

results.title: Discovering China and Tibet
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Video visits”.
Discover China, the 5,000-year-old “Middle Kingdom” and mysterious Tibet. The journey begins in Beijing, home to Chinese emperors for more than 500 years. Travel to Xian, the ancient capital, to examine a Neolithic village. Visit the birthplace of Confucius, then trek to Tibet’s mountainous land shrouded in Buddhist culture. Witness the effects of modernisation on the Chinese workplace that has transformed China into an awakening giant.

results.title: Great Cities of Europe
results.creator_credit: James R. Conner, International Video Network, Calcon, Valentini and Adler Enterprises
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Video visits”.
Enjoy a grand tour of Europe’s most renowned cities: London, Dublin, Amsterdam, Munich, Vienna, Salzburg, Paris, Madrid, Athens and Rome. See romantic castles, picturesque canals, lively piazzas and splendid parks; meet the Europeans at work and play.
